source: Extracted from Pastor Bob's sermon transcripts - VERIFIED FACTS ONLY

wife.name: Becky Kopeny

how_they_met_full_story.first_meeting: Bob first met Becky for about 3-4 minutes at the church next to hers years before they dated. He was helping lead a college Sunday School class and would stand by the door inviting college-aged people. She was walking by, said she went to Cal State Fullerton and worked at the Placentia library. She mentioned her boyfriend was waiting in the car.
how_they_met_full_story.reconnection_at_library: Years later, Bob was driving to Talbot Seminary and stopped at the intersection of Chapman and Kramer in Placentia. Out of the blue, 'Becky Cal State Fullerton Placentia library' came into his mind. He wasn't looking for a date. He drove into the library and asked if Becky Olson still worked there - she did. They chatted. She told him she was dating a guy seriously, possibly engaged, heading that direction. He was going to a Lutheran college and into ministry. Bob thought 'praise God' and left it at that.
how_they_met_full_story.second_visit: A month later, sitting at the same intersection, 'Becky' came to mind again. He drove in, she was there, they talked, he asked her out. She said okay. They went to breakfast, prayed together, had a great time as friends.
how_they_met_full_story.the_phone_call: Bob prayed for a week about whether to call her again. Felt nothing specific. Called multiple times - her roommate said she wasn't there. Finally reached her the next morning (woke her up). Asked if she'd like to go out sometime. She said 'what day?' He said 'any day you're free.' She said 'that makes it really hard.' Then he said 'I did need to share something God put on my heart last night.' She said 'when would you like to share that with me?' He said he didn't care. She said 'how about right now?'
how_they_met_full_story.the_revelation: Bob drove over, picked her up, they went out for coffee. At coffee, the Lord revealed to Bob BEFORE Becky told him something he did not know: she had gotten engaged to the other man the night before. She was now engaged.
how_they_met_full_story.friendship_period: They became just friends. Bob encouraged her spiritually. It wasn't romantic. He thought that might be all there was. God was using him in her life.
how_they_met_full_story.eventually_dating: Her engagement ended. They started dating. Three weeks after their first date, Bob felt God telling him to ask her to marry him.
how_they_met_full_story.proposal_conflict: Bob initially resisted because he had taught college-age kids to date for a year then be engaged for a year (based on 'Design for Christian Marriage' by Dwight Harvey Small). But God was telling him to propose after three weeks.
how_they_met_full_story.marriage: They got engaged and married about 3.5 months after their first date. Bob was about 25 when they married. Been together 35+ years as of 2017.

wife.marriage_commitment: Before they got married, Becky and Bob made decisions about never leaving one another in anger - if they disagreed they could disagree but would stay in the house.

mother.note: Bob was her fifth child. She passed away from cancer (lymph system).
mother.church_background: Lutheran - Bob says 'I got drugged to church every Sunday'

grandfather.death: Died of cancer of the lymph system at St. Jude
grandfather.last_conversation: Bob went to say goodbye and prayed with him

testimony.childhood_church: Lutheran church - his parents brought him to church every Sunday

salvation.when: In 8th grade (age 13) at a Jr. High church camp
salvation.where: A Jr. High church camp that his friend Fred invited him to attend
salvation.how: His friend Fred brought him to his church and to the camp. Two men - Jeff Maples and Gene Schaeffer (in their 30s, 'old men' to 13-year-old Bob) - had the boldness to share Christ with him. They didn't build a big relationship first - one night they shared for about five minutes and asked if he would receive Christ. He said yes.
salvation.experience: The night he received Christ there was no dramatic evidence - he didn't feel any different.
salvation.after_salvation: By 9th grade, still saved but 'you wouldn't have known it' - he wasn't living it out. Later Christian friends confronted him about living out his faith.
salvation.surrendering_prayer: He later prayed a 'surrendering prayer' that was different from the sinner's prayer - a prayer of full surrender to God

undergraduate.memorable_moment: First day at Biola, a classmate asked 'what's new' and replied with 'the 13th letter of the Greek alphabet' (nu)

graduate.chapel: The chapel at Talbot was called 'Calvary Chapel'
graduate.influential_professor: Wrote a book on prayer called 'Let's Pray'

law_enforcement.training: Attended and graduated from two police academies, paid his own way (in the 70s departments weren't hiring and putting people through)
law_enforcement.timeline: Was in law enforcement for years before seminary. After seminary, worked at Placentia Police Department even though he didn't really want the job at that point.

stories.station_wagon: Had to drive the old station wagon police car that nobody wanted - 'the old maid'
stories.sergeant_kim: Worked under a sergeant named Kim at Placentia PD who was hard to work for and didn't like Bob because he was a Christian
stories.jail_tour: Took his son to see the jail at the police department to show him where bad people go
stories.pursuit: A police officer he helped train went into a pursuit of a motorcycle on Alta Vista/High Ridge at over 100 mph

church.name: Mentioned in sermons as 'this church' or 'our church'
church.early_days: Started small, around 125 people at one point
